definition: to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages
(literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

sentences.english: There must be a hole somewhere, I can hear the water slopping about in the bottom of the boat.
sentences.chinese: 一定是哪儿有个洞，我听得见水在船底流荡的声音。

sentences.english: We could hear the director rebuking Jim for being late from work again.
sentences.chinese: 我们听得见主任在斥辞责吉姆上班又迟到了。

sentences.english: It has made a super stealth plane that cannot be seen or heard by anyone.
sentences.chinese: 它制造了没人看得见或者听得见的超级隐形飞机。

sentences.english: Together we've played" Hotel California", you can hear?
sentences.chinese: 我们曾经一起弹唱的《加州旅馆》，你还能听得见么？

sentences.english: We live within earstot of the factory whistle .
sentences.chinese: 我们住的地方听得见工厂汽笛声。

sentences.english: "Hui Fen, " his iterate, "Do you listen so that see me?
sentences.chinese: “惠芬，”他重复说，“你听得见我吗？”

sentences.english: A singer must learn to project his voice so as to be heard in a large hall.
sentences.chinese: 须学会把声音送得远，使会堂里的人都听得见。

sentences.english: The rest of the world hears you.
sentences.chinese: 全世界的人都能听得见。

sentences.english: I could hear the wives behind the thick door of our inner room, stirring there.
sentences.chinese: 透过厚实的门板，听得见隔壁房里众嫔妃沙沙的声音。

sentences.english: So loudly did he speak that even people in the next room could hear him .
sentences.chinese: 他讲话的声音那样大，连隔邻房子里的人都听得见。

sentences.english: Speak louder so that everyone could hear.
sentences.chinese: 大声点说话，让大家都听得见。

sentences.english: I could hear his heavy breathing.
sentences.chinese: 我听得见他粗重的呼吸。

sentences.english: I can still hear your perpetual calling for me.
sentences.chinese: 我仍旧听得见她那永恒的召唤。

sentences.english: I could hear the clock on the wall ticking.
sentences.chinese: 我听得见墙上的钟在滴答地响。

sentences.english: Or should I just beat the shit out of you until you do hear me.
sentences.chinese: 还是要我把你揍得屁滚尿流了才听得见？

sentences.english: So loudly did he speak that even people in the next room could hear him.
sentences.chinese: 他讲话声音那么大，隔壁屋里的人都听得见。

definition: not a sound to be heard (idiom)
to prick up one's ear and listen carefully
to prick up one's ears/to strain to hear sth
in a whisper/in a low voice (idiom)
